Articles.Content:
Formerly Messerchmitt ME 163 Komet thread.

Due to popular demand and my own decisions, this is now a Historical Aircraft thread!

Planes in progress/Completed/Nationality:

Komet (Below) German

Wright Flyer (COMPLETED) American

Macchi Mc 202 Folgore (COMPLETED) Italian

Macchi Castoldi Mc 72 (PENDING) Italian

Avro Arrow (WIP) Canadian

Hawker Hurricane (PENDING) British

Bell P39 Airacobra (COMPLETED) American

EWR VJ 101 (PENDING) German

Northrop P-61 Black Widow (PENDING) American

F-86 Sabre (PENDING) American

To suggest a Plane, it MUST meet these requirements:

1. You must include a name, nationality, and a pic showing side, front and top profiles (This is a good example of the picture part)

2. It has to be PRACTICAL (No Concept crafts that never flew, or planes that never got off the ground, Late WWII German Prototype planes are exempt from this on account that the actually did something in the war)

I am surprised that nobody has posted anything really substantial about this...

Well here it is, about an hours worth of tinkering, failing, and a little bit of over-excitement on the first landing.

Quotheth Wikipedia:

"The Messerschmitt Me 163 Komet, designed by Alexander Lippisch, was a German rocket-powered fighter aircraft. It is the only rocket-powered fighter aircraft ever to have been operational. Its design was revolutionary, and the Me 163 was capable of performance unrivaled at the time. German test pilot Heini Dittmar in early July 1944 reached 1,130 km/h (700 mph), not broken in terms of absolute speed until November 1947. Over 300 aircraft were built; however, the Komet proved ineffective as a fighter, having been responsible for the destruction of only about nine Allied aircraft (16 air victories for 10 losses, according to other sources)."

Looks good, no?

Bit unstable...

Came in too fast...

Dropbox Link

EDIT:Mods Needed:

TV Aerospace

Firespitter (for the tail wheel)

TT Modular Multiwheels

Tyberdyne Shuttle System (for the decoupler)

(I'm sure I forgot a mod, and if I did, please tell me in the thread, I get emailed about every post that is made so I will respond to it within the day.)

Also added a Readme!

Now to arm it...

Edited November 1, 2013 by Wormhol3
just upload the pictures in imgur.com and paste the links. The dropbox thingy needs a login.
Just make a Dropbox account.

We won't be able to access 'your' folders from another dropbox account

Imgur is way easier for sharing images, as it can give you directly the full code for displaying an image in the forums
Ok i'll try that. The images are removed from the Dropbox to save space, and uploading to Imgr.

We won't be able to access 'your' folders from another dropbox account

You can see them if they are put in the public dropbox folder and shared with the public link (RMB on the file).

I tried building one a while back. The wings looked terrible and it was too unstable to fly. By too unstable, I mean stuff like 90* oscillations in any and every direction. Just persuading it not to nosedive off the end of the runway was a challenge!
I made like 6 models of that a long time ago and some of it used jet engines, solid rocket boosters, aerospikes. They all landed on skids and had limited fuel

Lol, my first try didn't lift off. Second ran out of power and crashed. This is the third iteration with a hidden RTG. It has one of those new inline mini rockomaxes and two radials clipped in ever-so-neatly to give it enough thrust AND not be noticeable unless you look closely.
I was just thinking about a messerschmit style rocket-plane, actually. I'll see if I can make a look-alike with stock parts.

I would love to see,

Wright Flyer, the first powered flight aircraft. Lets start from the beginning.
I could do that, i have a skid mod i could use...
no option for russian planes?
I don't know how to edit the poll. Sorry! I was planning to add two more country's to the poll, Germany and Russia.
In that case, knock a vote off of britain and add it to Russia. I really like russian heavy fighters (War Thunder Addict).
Right there with ya. That's one of the reasons I made the Komet.

There should be an italian poll... Look the macchi mc 202 folgore, simply the best looking plane ever build imo

and this hydroplane for competition

Here it is! The Wright Flyer! !WARNING! NOT FLYABLE!

See?

American born and raised but my paternal Grandma was Canadian so let's give it up for the Avro Canada CF-105 Arrow.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avro_Canada_CF-105_Arrow

http://www.avro-arrow.org
Ahem... must we leave out some good Australian ones?
Is there a like cut off point for when the aircraft suggested have been made? like there are some historical craft in the 1960's but are u only doing WWI-WWII?
A Delta Wing? Challenge Accepted.
How about a Hawker Hurricane, my favorite that had its fame stolen by the spitfire:(
Simulating the Bell P39 Airacobra could be a bit difficult. No way to in effect have the engine behind the pilot with a driveshaft to the prop?
